title: Spatiotemporal Graph Convolutional Recurrent Neural Network Model for Citywide Air Pollution Forecasting. (arXiv:2304.12630v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Citywide Air Pollution Forecasting tries to precisely predict the air quality multiple hours ahead for the entire city. This topic is challenged since air pollution varies in a spatiotemporal manner and depends on many complicated factors. Our previous research has solved the problem by considering the whole city as an image and leveraged a Convolutional Long Short-Term Memory (ConvLSTM) model to learn the spatiotemporal features. However, an image-based representation may not be ideal as air pollution and other impact factors have natural graph structures. In this research, we argue that a Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) can efficiently represent the spatial features of air quality readings in the whole city. tldr: 该研究提出了一种面向城市空气污染预测的时空图形卷积循环神经网络模型，在整个城市的空气质量读数中有效地学习时空特征。
en_tdlr: This research presents a spatiotemporal graph convolutional recurrent neural network (Spatiotemporal GCRNN) model for citywide air pollution forecasting, which utilize a Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) architecture to efficiently represent spatial features of air quality readings in the whole city and tightly integrate it into an RNN structure to learn spatiotemporal characteristics of air quality values.
